reviewText: Hmmm...I'm partial to Mary McDonnell for some reason. I was not at all interested in the Closer before she entered the scene. I would be doing my work on my laptop while my wife watched it. Well, when Mary McDonnell made her appearance, her voice startled me, in the way a familiar, desirable sound would. Her whole attire - but especially her glasses - commanded respect, I felt as if I were in her presence, it was really spellbinding for me.  Her character (and by extension, she) exhibits a rare blend of sweetness  and elegance that I thought Brenda lacked.  In any case, the relationship between the women is priceless (going into it here would take several paragraphs so I'll refrain), I watched several episodes repeatedly. I personally think that if you enjoy watching successful, bright, strong yet gentle women that do not emasculate the men working for them, you would enjoy watching this as both Brenda and Sharon do a great job with that! As a woman myself, I found them inspiring and empowering.

reviewText: I miss this show tremendously, but what better way to relive the days of Brenda and her crew than on DVD.  This is a nice set with the complete sixth season contained within just a few DVDs.  The transfer and audio is very good and probably pretty close to the original broadcast quality from TNT.  My only question is why these are not released in HD???  A discerning buyer like myself would definitely purchase an HD version on Blu-ray but alas the DVD will have to do.  For what it is worth, this is a great presentation and the best available way to view The Closer from beginning to end.
summary: Fantastic Show, Wish It Could Have Been HD

reviewText: I'll start by saying that I haven't seen every single episode of The Closer, but I look forward to seeing them all. This show is so good. First of all, I think Kyra Sedgwick does a great Southern accent when playing her character. She really sounds like she's from Atlanta. Besides Brenda (who loves chocolate, just like me!), my two favorite characters are Tao and Provenza. They are both funny and you can bet Provenza will always be eating something. The characters go so well together. I'd rather watch this show over Law & Order and all those shows because these characters have personalities and they are what makes this show so enjoyable. Thumbs up here!

reviewText: First, The Closer is one of my favorite shows, and I love the cast and the writing.  And, of course, Brenda makes each week a joy and a pleasure to watch.I don't know what happened to this season, but is was truly terrible.  They moved into a new office that is spread out so much that the show has lost that family feeling and togetherness that made the show very cohesive and fast moving.  There are no more Fritz and Brenda moments, and I wonder if Fritz is leaving the cast, because he is rarely there. And, Brenda has lost her wonderful personality and acts like a Stepford Wife.  I thought maybe she was growing up, and was going to be Chief of Police, but that didn't happen.  The writing was very scattered and they did a whole ten episodes for this season.It seems like they have lost their way in the wilderness, and I hope they remember that wonderful saying----"if it isn't broken, don't try to fix it"  I sure hope it gets back to where it was last season, which was one of my favorites.

reviewText: How can you top the best season ever?  Very Simple.  Just do another season of The Closer with Kyra Sedgwick.The star and cast bring their top game, including the best in humor, while fighting crime.  The Keystone Cops don't havea thing better than this team when you need a good laugh. And in solving crimes, Brenda Leigh Johnson is the best.  No crime too big or too small for her.  She gives her best, while all the time having to outsmart an ignorant boss and jealous rivals within the L A Police Dept.My recommendation:  DON'T MISS A SINGLE EPISODE.

Title: N/A

reviewText: Love this show! Very interesting characters and subplots that weave through every episode, though every episode stands alone with its own crime to solve. It's not a serial where the whole plot continues to the next show. I like having resolution to the story in each episode. I've watched every season - wish there were more! This is a great crime show that's well written. I especially liked earlier seasons that did not strive for gore. But like every mystery/detective/crime show out there, as the seasons progress the gore/gruesomeness of the crimes is more explicitly depicted. Could have done without that. This show is strong without the sensationalism.
summary: Great Characters, good story lines, wonderful subplots

reviewText: There are many shows we watch that are in the general genre of The Closer, all detective shows. We like Castle, NCIS, CSI, Crossing Jordan, Body of Proof, and several others. But The Closer has easily become our favorite.We really enjoy the entire cast and how the writers weave their relationships into each episode. The humor of some episodes really makes a difference for us too. There is enough levity to keep us coming back but it doesn't interfere with the main point of the story which is finding the killer. The very popular Law and Order series lacks that humor which is why we have never been able to watch it.There is a variety in the episodes that also keeps it interesting. We've noted that there are a number of different directors which obviously contributes the the variety. There are a few episodes that we didn't like, but those are few and far between.It isn't uncommon to hear around our house these days, "Thank you, thank you SO much."

reviewText: For us old timers...you love/hate the characters like you did in Hillstreet Blues.... The acting is very good.  Being able to watch these on Prime and go from one show to the next, marathon style, you feel involved.  Brenda Lee makes decisions throughout all seasons that are nobel and dispicable.  You love her one minute, wanting to hand her a Hostess dingdong, and then you want to smack her and ask "what were you thinking?"  Flynn and Provenza are great comedy relief.  Then, the love story between Brenda and her FBI man--Fritz is a nice touch showing that she is not just all business but has a "real life" as well...although she puts her job first, mostly.  The Closer is worth the investment of time.  Had I found them and they had not been free to watch would I have purchased them, you ask...  a resounding YES!!!!!!!!!  I say!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Provenza and Flynn cannot believe their good luck when two flight attendants half their age pick them up for dates. After a dinner of laughs the two couples separate and begin their nocturnal activities. Provenza's date heads to the bedroom to change into a pink nightie with matching pink furry handcuffs and Provenza heads to the bathroom to get the baby oil and swallow his little sexual helper pill. Things come to a grinding halt when he turns and sees a murder victim in his date's bathtub. This show is one of the best of the Provenza and Flynn comedy episodes, with the older gents convinced the flight attendants found them hot and not just shields to protect them until their criminal activity is completed. Great writing and acting with a hilarious ending.
summary: Provenza and Flynn are at it again

reviewText: Well the good news is we have season 6...the good news is there well be a season 7 which starts they say July 11th. The sad news is Season 7 is the last we'll have of The Closer. I've seen nothing official about spin offs that some hopefuls here report...so hope they are right. On the other hand...we've got season 6 and season 7 to look forward to.We just watched the first disk...tonight..straight on through...Oh once we start watching it is so hard not to take in just one more...ok just one more....I hope the rumor there well be more shows in season 7 and not a split season as another suggests.....because there really are never enough episodes.....really. More when it comes to The Closer is better:)))Such a pleasing show...on so many levels it delivers...humor...drama....character development...relationships among characters.....the list goes on...what's missing EMMIES every year for all cast and crew and writers that's what's missing. You know they have put so much into this show...the rewards by their peers so lacking? Jealousy...perhaps. I'd like to think so.This season one disk into it...has so far delivered and so far like another reviewer who was upset with it....seems a tad off with the new building as if you too are lost and bumping into things and off balanced by everything bigger longer newer..different....but it works for us. We couldn't give it anything less then the 5 stars the actors deliver. A spin off...if everyone moved to NY so Kyra Sedgewick could continue that would be ok by us:)))) What a cast....what a show. We'll cherish all 7 seasons and all 7 and a half seasons if that does occur.
summary: Enjoying every bit and sad about Season 7 news.

reviewText: Quite simply, The Closer, throughout its tenure on TNT and reruns was an entertaining, thought-provoking, well-constructed storylines drama.  Witty and intelligent for the most part characters helped.  It's good that the same qualities of production and talents continue on Major Crimes.

reviewText: If you are a fan of the show this season will not disappoint!! Like any show on tv these days, it seems that with each passing season the story line goes down hill but not with the Closer! This season is one of the best to date (in my honest opinion). The acting has dramatically evolved since Season One. With each new episode you have your funny moments, sad moments, or happy moments. The best duo for laughs is without a doubt Flynn and Provenza - with these two you never know what will happen!!  I'd suggest you buy it if you are a loyal fan. No Ifs and or Buts about it.One suggestion I'd like to make to TNT or creator James Duff - Please make each season available in Blu-Ray!!

reviewText: "Closer" is the TV series that has everything.  Excellent stories with just the right mix of drama, humor and pathos.  Amazingly good action sequences.  Not a bad actor in a barrel-full. Kyra Sedgewick is excellent but the supporting staff is also marvelous.  If you haven't seen this show, you are missing one of the best shows on television.  And it has no peer among crime dramas.

reviewText: I liked The Closer. Ok...I was actually sad as I watched the last episode. I'd grown attached to the characters, and how the plot often depicted real life situations, office politics, etc.I stream TV via my Roku & high speed internet, versus having regular cable (I *upsidedown heart* Comcast,) so I never saw this show in real time, but gobbled the series up over the course of a few weeks, watching a few episodes at a time. And you're right, it's not Masterpiece Theater, but it was good fun, good writing and dialogue, believable people and problems. Fun filler after a long day.

reviewText: Most shows head downhill quickly around season 4. Not so for The Closer. This is a season of humor and conflict with the viewer catching their breat more than once per episode. My favorite episodes are the one in which Captain Raidor helps Brenda in her quest to become the new Chief of Police. The viewer gets to see a new relationship develop as both women put aside their differences and gain respect for one another. Their is still conflict there, but no longer a hostile one.All the characters come along in further development. The Closer keeps getting better. I highly recommend it as part of your Closer collection.

reviewerName: Wayne Klein "If at first the idea is not absu...
reviewText: The sixth season of "The Closer" remains a favorite of mine. The changing relationships, the ruffled feathers caused by Captain Raydor (Mary McDonnell)gives Brenda a character that she can butt heads with that is every bit her equal (except for rank)and there's a game changing episode involving a gangbanger, the murder of two people at a store and Brenda's decision at the end to let him go that sets up the big conflict of season sixth AND demonstrates a shift in her character.As with the previous seasons Warner Home Video has done a nice job with the tranfer here--it looks quite nice with bold colors, nice detail, etc. Audio also sounds quite strong with a nice use of surround speakers in some of the more action driven sequences of the show.While many fans could care less about commentary tracks I like them--they can make an episode fresh (with the right people on the commentary track)and give us interesting insight into how difficult or easy it was to pull off a particular episode. Sadly there aren't any here which has been a flaw of every season of "The Closer" on DVD. Perhaps they are going to roll some out for Blu-ray (which hopefully we'll see one of these days although it doesn't appear to be too big a priority for Warner when it comes to this show)but, given that the show is wrapping with the seventh season, it would be nice if they included a commentary track or two at some point.As with the previous seasons we get deleted scenes for selected episodes and a gag reel. We do get a nice featurette "Kyra Sedgwick Open Up About The Closer" allowing the actress to open up about her take her character and the series.Over all this is a fine set although I do have to question WHY Warner's art department decided to airbrush the picture of Sedgwick on the cover--she's a beautiful 40 something and cleaning up the lines on her face seems rather odd particularly given that none of the other cast members were subjected to that. She looks great the way she is (and I'm sure Kevin Bacon her husband would agree) so why not let us see her the way nature intended?Highly recommended.
summary: Game changing sixth season is one of the finest of "The Closer".

reviewText: Well, maybe so.  But this one drew me in.  Each episode was well executed.  The plots were always believable.  The characters were always believable.  Great casting!  Like any good series, the personal lives, traits, and personalities of the main characters made me want to learn more about them and follow their activities, both professionally and personally.  I considered time spent watching this series time well spent.
summary: Was there a better police procedural soap opera on TV?
